title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 July 2014 - XWiki
content:
<teekayz> has joined #xwiki  
03:05 <teekayz> hey guys, is there a way to disable the main wiki and only use the sub wiki? Or can you only do this by denying access to everyone  
03:05 <teekayz> sub wikis\*  
03:24 <teekayz> Also, I get quite a few null pointer exceptions when I try and load my side bar navigation. Here's the log, I'm not sure if this has been fixed already but just putting it out there  
03:24 <teekayz> http://pastebin.com/rrAd1Eqk

10:33 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, what could be the possible issues when using "@Inject MyCustomComponentWhichImplementsEventListener" in custom script service causes that script service to fail loading? ($services.customscriptservice is null)  
10:36 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you are supposed to use the role with @Inject, not the component implementation class  
10:40 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yes, i have 3 classes, MyScriptService (implements ScriptService), MyComponent (public interface), DefaultMyComponent (implements MyComponent, EventListener)... if i use @Inject MyComponent myComponentInstance; in MyScriptService, it fails to load, yet according to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents it should work  
10:42 <tmortagne> well what does the error say exactly ?  
10:42 <tmortagne> you should get an error log when the script service fail to load  
10:43 <DarkKnightCZ> well, there is no error, it just fails to load... i've tuned logback, give me a sec if it shows something  
10:44 <tmortagne> does MyScriptService have @Component annotation ?  
10:44 <tmortagne> and the right @Named  
10:44 <tmortagne> the only way to not have error log is for the script service to not being found at all  
10:45 <tmortagne> otherwise any issue when loading it is calling log.error  
10:45 <tmortagne> well depends on your XWiki version actually  
10:45 <tmortagne> it used to be debug only logs  
10:46 <DarkKnightCZ> http://pastebin.com/BRbz2CPE , so i guess the issue is with the event listener  
10:46 <DarkKnightCZ> got to go for a few minutes  
10:47 <tmortagne> an EventListener should always declare a unique @Named  
10:47 <tmortagne> and you just found a bug with DefaultSecurityCacheRulesInvalidator...

14:02 <tillo> Hello there! Is there any way I can help solve http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ADMINTOOL-11 ? It's kind of blocking a project of ours. :)  
14:03 <vmassol> tillo: we can help you fix it  
14:05 <vmassol> maybe the problem is here https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-admintools/blob/master/src/main/resources/Admin/ExportPage.xml#L39  
14:06 <vmassol> and a Document Reference should be used instead  
14:07 <vmassol> the problem I think is that the user picks a full name instead of picking a space + a page name  
14:08 <vmassol> this is what I see at https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-admintools/blob/master/src/main/resources/Admin/ExportPage.xml#L30  
14:09 <vmassol> so the UI needs needs to be modified to let the user specify both the space + page name  
14:09 <vmassol> otherwise if you have A.B.C you can't guess if:  
14:09 <vmassol> - space = A.B, page = C  
14:09 <tillo> Would it be the same bug as exporting an entire space?  
14:09 <vmassol> - soace = A, page = B.C  
14:09 <vmassol> \*space  
14:10 <vmassol> note that I have \*never\* used nor read the source of this app  
14:10 <vmassol> it's not maintained by any of us here  
14:10 <vmassol> and I have no idea what you mean by "same bug as exporting an entire space" :)  
14:11 <tillo> I meant using Export instead of ExportPage  
14:11 <vmassol> what does export do?  
14:11 <tillo> You can select multiple pages/spaces as far as I know.  
14:11 <tillo> That should bring both the space and the name.  
14:11 <vmassol> so I guess export calls exportPage  
14:11 <vmassol> the code is here btw: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-admintools/tree/master/src/main/resources/Admin  
14:11 <tillo> Yeah  I guessed so too  
14:12 <tillo> Since a Space can't have dots, would it be a better fix to split at the first dot instead of the last one?  
14:12 <vmassol> actually tmortagne seems to have participated to this app a bit ;)  
14:12 <vmassol> a space \*can\* have dots  
14:12 <tillo> Oh  
14:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: I never works on export part of admin tools no  
14:13 <tillo> Then you are right, I've to look for the same bug within Export.xml or, if it's using ExportPage.xml, fix it there.  
14:13 <tmortagne> I always use http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export  
14:13 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're mentioned on https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-admintools/blob/master/src/main/resources/Admin/Export.xml ;)  
14:14 <vmassol> (that's why I mentioned your name)  
14:14 <vmassol> apparently you just did some formatting ;)  
14:14 <tillo> tmortagne: I don't know if my colleague know about that project or if it rejected it because it did not met the requirements. I'll check with him.  
14:15 <vmassol> tillo: would be nice to tell us about your reqs indeed  
14:15 <vmassol> since there might be other ways of achieving what you need  
14:16 <tmortagne> yep would be easier to know your need and XWiki version too  
14:16 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export is configurable but its a bit of rough  
14:16 <tillo> Yes, he's currently looking into it. He says he rejected it because he wasn't able to choose specific groups of pages or spaces, as far as he can remember.  
14:17 <tillo> Did it evolute lately?  
14:17 <tmortagne> there is no advanced UI for it but you can provide the where part of a SQL request  
14:18 <tmortagne> so you can select anything you want that way  
14:18 <tmortagne> "Something to put after 'select distinct doc.fullName from XWikiDocument as doc' basically"  
14:19 <tillo> That's great. That query is directly accessible or a new page calling it is required?  
14:19 <tmortagne> the other way is to simply export it all and remove what you don't want in the XAR  
14:19 <tillo> That I remember was out of the question because of the size.  
14:19 <tmortagne> the request is a field in the UI  
14:20 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export has been made to export wikis of any size  
14:20 <tmortagne> what version of XWiki is it ?  
14:20 <tillo> 4.4.1  
14:20 <tillo> At least the "guest" pages, don't know about the rest.  
14:22 <tmortagne> ok  
14:24 <tillo> Ok I'm blocking some of his time to look at this project again and try either to modify the request or doing a selection on import.  
14:24 <tillo> If that's not working we'll be back later this week. Thank you !  
14:29 <tmortagne> tillo: I was not really talking about import  
14:29 <tmortagne> a XAR is just a zip with the pages, you can remove there anything you want  
14:29 <tillo> Would it remove attachments, or are they easy to spot?  
14:30 <tillo> them\*  
14:30 <tmortagne> each page (and its attachments) are located in a XML file in the XAR  
14:30 <tillo> Then I'll add that to the task note. Thanks.  
14:30 <tmortagne> and each space is represented by a folder in the XAR with the XML pages in it  
14:31 <tillo> Nice.  
14:31 <DarkKnightCZ> what is best document identifier a for using as key in hashmap? fullname?  
14:31 <tillo> Also the destination version would be 6.0 or higher. Would not be a problem right?  
14:35 <polx> has quit  
14:36 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: well it all depend what is unique in your map exactly  
14:37 <tmortagne> tillo: that should not be a problem no  
14:38 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: XWikiDocument#getId() does not take into accound the wiki  
14:38 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: document has to be unique in whole wiki (in all subwikis) and it has to be recoverable (i need to obtain document from that key), because documentreference can be different instance when searching for that in hashmap, i guess stringifying documentreference should be good, right?  
14:38 <tmortagne> meaning that two similar document in two different wikis might have the same id  
14:38 <DarkKnightCZ> since it returns something like subwiki:Documents.Sandbox  
14:40 <tmortagne> be carefull with that, each language of a document is a different document with the same reference  
14:40 <tmortagne> but of you don't care about translations it's fine  
14:40 <DarkKnightCZ> yup, great  
14:41 <tmortagne> another possibility is to use the DocumentReference directly as key  
14:41 <tmortagne> unless you absolutely want your map to use String as key  
14:44 <DarkKnightCZ> yeah, i was using DocumentReference as a key now, but i'm not sure if it would work without any issue (for example when obtaining documentreference for the same document, but it will be diferent instance, that could cause misbehaving and not obtaining values... also that documentreference will be held "forever" -> until wiki restart)  
14:45 <tmortagne> DocumentReference is not very big but yes a bit bigger than a String and you should not have any more issues that with it's String representation  
14:46 <DarkKnightCZ> ok then, i will have the document reference for now, i will test it later if it causes some issues  
14:46 <tmortagne> DocumentReference are not modifiable if that's what you worry about  
14:54 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <msmeria> has quit  
15:11 <polx> has quit  
15:29 <Denis> has quit  
15:31 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <Enygma`> maven question (vmassol, tmortagne, anyone): I`m trying to execute this plugin http://hastebin.com/aficinocuw.xml betwrrn step 3 and 4 here https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/pom.xml#L73 but, no matter what I do, it is always executed before step 3.  
15:46 <Enygma`> the plugin and step 3 run in the same phase, but even if they are listed in the <plugins> section as first step 3 and then my plugin, the <plugins> order is ignored and my plugin always gets executed after step 3.  
15:47 <Enygma`> using maven 3.0.4 and now 3.0.5  
15:47 <tmortagne> Enygma`: no idea if the order is supposed to be respected officially  
15:47 <Enygma`> I found that it is supposed to be respected  
15:47 <tmortagne> that would be my first reflex too  
15:48 <Enygma`> http://www.mkyong.com/maven/maven-plugin-execution-order-in-same-phase/ and others  
15:49 <tmortagne> and you are sure you are executing that with maven 3.0.5 ?  
15:49 <Enygma`> yes... was using 3.0.4 first and now I have installed 3.0.5  
15:51 <tmortagne> you could try with more recent version of Maven maybe, if it's definitely a bug in 3.0.5 I guess we can try to speed up a bit our support of Maven 3.1+  
15:51 <Enygma`> ok, let me try the latest maven...  
15:53 <Enygma`> same with 3.2.2 :|  
15:53 <tmortagne> I also confirm that dependency plugin phase is pre-integration-test at least  
15:54 <tmortagne> so looks like http://www.mkyong.com/maven/maven-plugin-execution-order-in-same-phase/ is not so true  
15:54 <tmortagne> try to generate an effective pom  
15:54 <tmortagne> see if the order does not change for some reason  
15:55 <tmortagne> could be because we are using maven-resources-plugin several times  
15:55 <polx> has quit  
15:56 <Enygma`> hmm, indeed, through black magic, the order is reversed in the effective pom  
15:56 <tmortagne> try to explicitely put an id to the first one  
15:56 <tmortagne> I don't have an id in the effective pom for the other one  
15:57 <tmortagne> it's defined in enterprise-test  
15:58 <Enygma`> for the other maven-resources-plugin execution, right?  
15:58 <tmortagne> yep  
15:58 <Enygma`> because indeed, there are 2 executions and maybe the grouping messes things up  
15:58 <tmortagne> since the first one does not have an id maybe it's a bit lost  
15:59 <tmortagne> if it's not it I don't have other idea :)  
15:59 <tmortagne> if it's working you should probably put ids on all the plugins in enterprise-test  
16:02 <Enygma`> same result :(  
16:02 <Enygma`> defined an Id in enterprise-test and used it in enterprise-test-ui  
16:02 <Enygma`> effective pom is still grouped  
16:02 <Enygma`> and execution is still in the unwanted order  
16:03 <cjd\_> is now known as <cjd>  
16:06 <tmortagne> Enygma`: you end up with both execution in the same <plugin> ?  
16:08 <Enygma`> in effective, yes  
16:08 <tmortagne> hmm wondering if that's not actually something standard in Maven  
16:08 <Enygma`> I get resources plugin, with 2 executions, each with their ID and phase and then I get the dependency plugin  
16:08 <tmortagne> (that you have to put all <execution> in the same <plugin>)  
16:09 <tmortagne> I remember having issues like this like only the first one being taken into account  
16:11 <tmortagne> so that would not really be an ordering issue but more automatic merge with parent  
16:12 <Enygma`> I find it reasonable that the executions are merged into one...  
16:12 <Enygma`> but how then can you control the order in which plugins execute inside a phase?  
16:13 <tmortagne> did you try to put both maven-resources-plugin after the maven-dependency-plugin ?  
16:13 <Enygma`> if the effective pom "corrects" any ordering you might have applied  
16:13 <Enygma`> trying...  
16:13 <tmortagne> if it had to merge execution it has to pick one  
16:13 <tmortagne> and I guess it just pick the first one  
16:13 <tmortagne> it's not really like reordering  
16:14 <Enygma`> heh, that worked :)  
16:14 <Enygma`> it does make sense by that judgmenet, but the process is more or less flawed :)  
16:15 <tmortagne> well it makes sense if Maven force all execution to be in the same <plugin>  
16:15 <tmortagne> when if find a new one it adds it to the first it found  
16:15 <tmortagne> (even if I don't really see the point in merging all execution...)  
16:15 <Enygma`> but that just looks like an early optimisation :)  
16:16 <tmortagne> not very usefull, it's not event the same goals so not the same classes to load  
16:16 <tmortagne> s/event/even/  
16:17 <Enygma`> it also messes up the readability of the pom.xml  
16:17 <Enygma`> when instead of the natural order, you clump everything at the end...  
16:17 <tmortagne> yea it's not very nice  
16:19 <Enygma`> now, I`m not very sure, but it also seems that if in pluginManagement I have defined 2 executions but in plugins I use only 1, both seem to be executed  
16:19 <Enygma`> how do I execute just one execution for a plugin?  
16:20 <Enygma`> this should be just one execution, right? http://hastebin.com/vunaxalebi.xml  
16:21 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I added a comment in http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10545  
16:23 <tmortagne> Enygma`: pluginManagement act for the whole plugin, you are allows to override one of the execution using the id but I don't think not repeating an execution mean you won't have it  
16:23 <tmortagne> you will have to overwrite the one you don't want I think and disable it some way  
16:23 <tmortagne> many goal have a "skip" properties  
16:24 <Enygma`> hm, I see... well, that was just a curiosity for the moment  
16:24 <tmortagne> s/properties/property/

17:15 <vmassol> and an answer :)

17:15 <vmassol> Keph is you? :)  
17:15 <gdelhumeau> yes  
17:15 <vmassol> haha  
17:16 <vmassol> indeed I've just checked and we use the xwiki syntax 2.1 link parser  
17:16 <vmassol> so any xwiki syntax 2.1 is supported  
17:22 <mbloom> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <mbloom> I am trying to create multiple wiki’s but am running into some trouble. When I go through the steps to set-up a new wiki and then click ‘create’, I’m brought to a page that says “The requested document could not be found” instead of taking me to the Distribution Wizard. Any help would be appreciated  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> mbloom: what happens if you go to Wiki Index?  
17:27 <mbloom> It is listed, however if I click on it I’m brought to that notice as mentioned above  
17:27 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
17:27 <gdelhumeau> what is your version?  
17:28 <mbloom> 6.0  
17:29 <tmortagne> mbloom: are you authenticated after you click on it ?  
17:30 <mbloom> If i were to click the link that says “You can edit this page to create it.” I am brought to the “DocumentDoesNotExist” page which looks as though it’s in the main wiki  
17:30 <mbloom> @tmortagne, what do you mean?  
17:31 <tmortagne> look at the top right corner  
17:31 <tmortagne> do you see your user name or a login button ?  
17:32 <mbloom> I am still properly authenticated after I create it  
17:32 <tmortagne> when you see “The requested document could not be found” you are authenticated ?  
17:32 <mbloom> correct  
17:33 <tmortagne> what URL do you have in that case ?  
17:34 <mbloom> https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/view/Main/  
17:36 <tmortagne> do you see the name of your wiki in the top bar ?  
17:37 <tmortagne> just near Add button  
17:37 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <mbloom> I am not using the standard navbar, header. I am running this on a website that we have had in deployment for a while but have recently upgraded to 6.0  
17:38 <tmortagne> so you overwrite things like view.vm, right ?  
17:38 <tmortagne> do you get the DW https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/distribution/XWiki/Distribution ?  
17:39 <tmortagne> redirecting to the DW is a skin decision so if you overwrite the skin you need to be careful about that  
17:39 <mflorea> has quit  
17:40 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: does the wiki creation goes directly to DW URL now ?  
17:40 <gdelhumeau> no  
17:40 <mbloom> I see. But yeah my issue lies with not being able to get to the DW  
17:40 <tmortagne> you mean not being redirected ?  
17:41 <mbloom> Not being redirected or being able to get it to load with the URL you sent me  
17:42 <tmortagne>  what do you get with https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/distribution/XWiki/Distribution ?  
17:42 <tmortagne> it does not load at all ?  
17:43 <mbloom> “The requested document could not be found."  
17:44 <tmortagne> you sure you use exactly https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/distribution/XWiki/Distribution ? distribution action does not load any document so I really don't see how you can end up with a message like this  
17:48 <mbloom> when I run it on my main wiki, (https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/bin/distribution/XWiki/Distribution) it displays the following message: null platform.extension.distributionWizard.${currentStepId}StepTitle  
17:49 <tmortagne> ha crap my url is wrong sorry, got tricked by your first URL  
17:49 <tmortagne> https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/bin/distribution/XWiki/Distribution  
17:49 <tmortagne> /bin/ was missing  
17:50 <tmortagne> hmm well not so sure  
17:50 <tmortagne> forget that https://testdev.elasticbeanstalk.com/wiki/MyNewWiki/distribution/XWiki/Distribution should be fine  
17:50 <mbloom> still “The requested document could not be found.” Yeah I’m not sure what it has decided to do to the naming convention  
17:51 <tmortagne> “The requested document could not be found.” with that URL does not make any sense  
17:51 <tmortagne> unless you have some URL rewritting  
17:56 <tmortagne> sorry I have to go but seems to me you have two issues:  
17:59 <tmortagne> has quit
